title: DATS dataset distribution schema
description: (From DCAT) Represents a specific available form of a dataset. Each dataset might be available in different forms, these forms might represent different formats of the dataset or different endpoints. Examples of distributions include a downloadable CSV file, an API or an RSS feed.

storedIn.description: The data repository(ies) hosting the dataset.

dates.description: Relevant dates for the datasets, at a minimum, creation date needs to be added

version.description: A release point for the dataset when applicable.

accessModalities.description: The information about access modality for the dataset.

conformsTo.description: A data standard whose requirements and constraints are met by the dataset.

unit.description: The unit of measurement used to estimate the size of the dataset (e.g, petabyte). Ideally, the unit should be coming from a reference controlled terminology.
